summary: This is a forwarded email from December 30, 2019, between FBI personnel discussing ABC News's planned special reports on Jeffrey Epstein. The sender expresses concern about the timing of potential arrests of Ghislaine Maxwell and another individual in relation to the airing of the news story, to maintain credibility with victims and avoid the appearance of reacting to media pressure.

persons.name: Amy Robach
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of ABC News planning special reports on Jeffrey Epstein; her name appears in the URL of the referenced Variety article.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as a subject of potential arrest by SDNY; the sender argues arrests should happen before an ABC News story airs to maintain credibility.

events.title: Planned ABC News Special Reports on Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: ABC News was scheduled to air special reports on Jeffrey Epstein, as reported by Variety.

events.title: FBI Email Discussion on Arrest Timing
events.description: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent emails colleagues discussing the timing of potential arrests of Ghislaine Maxwell and another individual in relation to an upcoming ABC News story, to avoid losing credibility with victims.

keyFacts: An FBI Supervisory Special Agent expressed concern in December 2019 that arrests of Ghislaine Maxwell and another individual should occur before ABC News aired its special reports on Jeffrey Epstein in January 2020.
The concern was based on maintaining credibility with victims and avoiding the perception that law enforcement was merely reacting to media pressure.
The email indicates internal FBI/NYPD coordination and awareness of media schedules in relation to investigative timing.
The document references a Variety article from 2019 detailing ABC News's plans for special reports anchored by Amy Robach.
